name: Articuno

attacks.name: Freeze Dry
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

strengths: Freeze Dry can Paralyze for board control
Blizzard can spread damage to opponent's bench
weaknesses: Blizzard can backfire and damage your own bench
Coin flip reliance makes it inconsistent
Slow to power up without Rain Dance support
synergies: Pokemon Center (heal bench damage from Blizzard)
counters: Energy Removal slows down energy-intensive attacks
Lightning Pokemon hit for decent damage
Faster attackers can KO before Articuno is ready

competitiveHistory: Articuno was primarily used in Blastoise Rain Dance decks as a powerful Basic attacker. Its lack of weakness was highly prized, and the potential to spread bench damage with Blizzard made it threatening. Freeze Dry's paralysis chance provided additional utility. While not as universally played as some cards, it was a solid choice in Water-based strategies.

rulings.ruling: Blizzard's bench damage is mandatory based on the coin flip result - you must apply it even if it damages your own Pokemon.
Weakness and Resistance are not applied to benched Pokemon when calculating Blizzard's bench damage.
If Articuno has no weakness, it takes normal damage from all types.
